intro: Matelea gracilis, commonly known as the slender matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, often with contrasting white or yellow markings. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Matelea gracilis is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
